description: The Repository Interaction Service subsystem is responsible for all operations related to interacting with and managing code repositories. Its functionalities include repository acquisition, version control operations like checking out branches and diffing, and ensuring the underlying Git environment is correctly configured. It serves as the primary interface for the project to retrieve and manipulate source code from external Git repositories, acting as a core input handler for code analysis.

components.name: Git Environment Manager
components.description: This component is responsible for verifying the presence and readiness of the Git environment and its necessary libraries. It acts as a foundational utility, ensuring that all Git-dependent operations can proceed without encountering missing dependency errors.

components.name: Repository Acquisition & Management
components.description: Manages the initial acquisition of code repositories, including cloning repositories from a given URL, sanitizing repository URLs for security and correctness, and performing basic information retrieval such as verifying repository existence and extracting its name. It also handles checking out specific branches or commits.

components.name: Git Diff Processor
components.description: This component is dedicated to extracting and processing differences between various versions of code within a Git repository. It can generate structured representations of these changes, which are essential for subsequent analysis by other components (e.g., the AI Interpretation Layer).
